text: ertips or toes Missing pinky fingernails or toenails Distinctive facial features, such as a wide mouth, thick lips, thick eyelashes and brows, wide nose, and flat nasal bridge Extra hair growth on the face and body Sparse scalp hair Other symptoms that have been described in infants and children with Coffin-Siris syndrome include: Small head size Frequent respiratory infections in infancy Feeding difficulty in infancy Failure to thrive  Short stature Low muscle tone Loose joints Eye abnormalitie
